title: 4D Gantt
description: Create schedules and link tasks to project objects and visualize schedules as 4D simulation.
content:
4D Gantt is a powerful scheduling tool that replaces separate scheduling tools like MS Project or Primavera. It is used for managing project schedules.

Toolbar

Import Import schedule from MS Project, Primavera and IFC formats
Export Export schedule to MS Project, Primavera, PDF, PNG, Excel or iCal formats
Set as baseline Saves the current schedule as a baseline for comparison
Undo / Redo Undo or redo changes

Tasks

Add tasks with the Plus button
Edit task name, start and end date, duration and progress
Hierarchical structure: tasks can contain subtasks
Link tasks to each other with dependencies (FS, FF, SS, SF)

4D Simulation

Link tasks to model objects and visualize the schedule as a 4D simulation. With the Timeline tool you can play the animation and see the project progress over time.

title: Calculations
description: Sum up project or model quantities even at object level.
content:
The Calculation tool is a powerful spreadsheet calculation that enables calculations based on data model object metadata.

Functionality

New Create a new calculation
Name Calculation name
Level Calculation is based on file or object attributes
Save Save the current calculation
Export Export the current calculation in Excel format

Spreadsheet

Data Select content for the first column
  Folder Separate rows by data tree folders
  Attribute Separate rows by object attribute values
Column Select calculation content for columns
  Summary Calculates the total sum of selected attribute values
  Quantity Counts the number of objects

Cell Rules

Spreadsheet cells can contain all kinds of formulas. Almost all the same formulas are supported as in Excel.

Tips

Create a quick cost calculation: select Data: Attribute "Material" Column: Attribute "Volume". Add columns "Unit Price" and "Total Price" with your own formulas.

title: Clipping Plane
description: Clip models horizontally, vertically or along a road centerline.
content:
The Clipping Plane tool is used to cut models open and create cross-section views in 3D space.

Horizontal

The horizontal clipping plane cuts models horizontally. This is useful for examining e.g. building floor plans.

Vertical

The vertical clipping plane cuts models vertically along a straight line between two points. This is useful for e.g. examining building structures along a wall line.

Along Road Centerline

The road centerline clipping cuts models similar to a vertical clip, but perpendicular to and following the road centerline. You can adjust the clipping plane position by station number.

title: Data Management
description: Add, edit and organize project data sources.
content:
The data tree tool is used to manage all project data sources, organize them into folders, manage access rights, and control how data appears in 3D views.

Toolbar

Add data Opens a dialog with tabs for different data types. Select the data type, choose data type-specific import settings and press the Add button.
Add folder Adds a new folder under the currently selected folder.
Update data Upload a new version of a model file. This creates a new version that appears in the data tree under the model hierarchy.
Download Download the selected data file.
Data settings Adjust settings for the selected data source.
Rename Rename the data source with a new name.
Hide Make the data source visible / hide it.
Zoom to data Move the current view to fit the data source.
Re-import Re-import the selected data source.
Delete Delete the selected data.

title: Display Modes
description: Switch between 2D, 3D, GPS, fullscreen and VR modes.
content:
The tool has the following viewing modes:

3D – Default mode that displays the view in 3D perspective mode
2D – Isometric top-down view, also commonly known as "map view". Removes the perspective view.
GPS – Activates the device's GPS positioning and zooms to the device location. GPS mode also has a compass mode that rotates the user's view to the directional device compass points.
VR – Activates dual rendering mode that displays an image rendered for both eyes. Can be used with VR headsets that support such visualization modes.

title: Feedback Report
description: Compile all feedback into one table and export to Excel for detailed analysis.
content:
The Feedback Report is used to combine all feedback into one table to facilitate feedback analysis.

Functionality

Scroll through feedback responses in the table
Export the feedback table as an Excel file for further analysis
Emoji responses are stored as numbers in the Excel file in order of the emoji icon (default 0 = very happy and 4 = very unhappy)

Tips

Perform feedback statistics in Excel by calculating the mean, median, etc. of feedback results
Analyze feedback with AI by downloading the feedback report to Excel and asking questions to AI

title: Feedback
description: Give structured feedback with customizable feedback forms.
content:
The Feedback tool is used to collect feedback from project's internal or external stakeholders, such as the public, local residents, project neighbors, decision-makers and other stakeholders.

Functionality

The feedback button in the left toolbar opens the general feedback form with questions
Feedback "?" icons in the 3D view open location-linked feedback forms
Each feedback form is different and is defined by the project team
Answer the feedback questions and press the Submit button

title: Hide
description: Hide objects or areas from data sources.
content:
The Hide tool is used to hide parts of existing data sources at project level. For example, you can hide buildings to be demolished from under new ones.

Hide Objects

The tool colors objects that you can hide with random colors
Select in the 3D view the objects you want to hide. Selected objects turn red.
Select red objects you want back visible, or use the "Show all" button.
The Save button saves the list of hidden objects

Hide Area

The Area button starts the area drawing function
Draw a polyline around the area you want to hide
Finally right-click to finish drawing

title: Measurement
description: Measure points, distances, lengths and areas.
content:
The Measurement tool is used to take and mark measurements in the 3D view.

Measurement Types

Point Measure coordinates of a single point
Distance Measure the distance between two points
Length Measure the total length of a polyline
Area Measure the area of a polyline region

Functionality

Click in the 3D view to set measurement points
Measurement results are displayed in real time
Measurements can be saved to the project

title: Navigation
description: Navigate easily with a mouse or touch screens.
content:
Mouse
Mouse navigation follows the familiar navigation from common map applications:
Left button Pan from place to place while maintaining the same height and camera angle
Middle button Zoom in / out either by pressing the button and moving the mouse or using the mouse wheel
Right button Rotate around the object under the mouse cursor horizontally / vertically
All navigation takes the object under the mouse as the center point of navigation. By pointing at e.g. a building corner, you can rotate around that corner.
Touch Screens
Touch screen navigation also follows familiar navigation from common map applications:
One finger Pan the same way as with a mouse
Pinch with two fingers Zoom in or out the same way as with a mouse
Rotate with two fingers Rotate the same way as with a mouse

title: Organization Management
description: Manage users, projects, licenses, database space and libraries at organization level.
content:
The organization management tool is only available to organization administrators and is used for managing the organization's projects, users, licenses, usage quotas, as well as organization-level libraries and logs.

Settings

Edit organization's basic information:

Logo The logo is displayed in the top right corner of all projects. Only available if a special whitelabel license has been purchased.
Name
Address
Email addresses new users are automatically assigned as organization users if the user's email domain is one of the domains listed here

Projects

List of all projects created in this organization.

Add new project Adds a new project under the organization
Edit Edit the project's basic settings without opening the project
Delete Deletes the project

Users

List of all users created in this organization.

Role The user's role in the organization

title: Profile Settings
description: Manage user profile information and settings.
content:
Profile settings are used to edit the user profile:

Profile picture – User's personal image. Currently not in use, reserved for future features.
Username – Change the user's username, which is the user's display name in many tools.
Email – Change the user's email address. This requires a working email, as the new email address is verified before it becomes active.
First and last names – User's real name
Language – Language used in the user interface. 6DPlanner is translated into multiple languages, so users can use the tool in their native language. The language setting also affects how numbers, dates, and other values are displayed.
Delete my account – Delete the user account. Be careful when using this, as it cannot be reversed. Users are permanently removed from the system.
Change password – Change the user's password.

title: Project List
description: Manage user's own projects and create new projects.
content:
The project list shows all projects you are a member of. The list is divided into three sections:

My projects – projects you have created
Invited projects – projects that other users have invited you to
Project templates – project templates used to create new projects

Each project has buttons for project management:

Project settings – Access basic project settings directly without opening the project
Leave – Leave a project you have joined by invitation. This only applies to invited projects.
Clone project – Create a copy of the project, for example to create multiple versions of the same project
Delete – Deletes the project. Deleted projects are only marked as deleted and data is retained for 30 days in case of accidental deletion. If you want to restore a project, contact support. After 30 days, a deleted project can no longer be restored.

title: Project Settings
description: Manage users, roles, property data, libraries, feedback forms, workflows and other settings at project level.
content:
Project settings define project-specific settings for different tools.

Note: Some settings are only available for project manager user roles.

General Settings

Project Image

The project image allows setting a thumbnail for the project in the project list. By default, it is automatically created from the project's first view.

Start Image

The start image allows setting a custom quick-help image that is shown to users when they open the project.

Project Name

The project name is shown in the project list and in the browser title as the web page name.

Coordinate System

The active coordinate system used for example in model placement or displaying coordinates in the Measurement tool.

title: Queries
description: Find model objects using even complex search criteria.
content:
The Query tool is a powerful integrated database search that enables quick finding of BIM objects from large project data.

Functionality

New Define a new query rule
Save Save an existing query rule
Execute Execute the actively selected query rule

Rule Editor

Use AND / OR / XOR rules to define multiple conditions
Use "Folder" rule to limit queries to a specific folder
Use "Attribute" rule to search based on attribute values
Use "Data type" rule to limit queries to specific data types

Result Style

Result Presentation styles for results
Others Presentation styles for other data
Color Object color
Transparency Object transparency
Visibility Force results visible / hidden

Tips

Link query results to 4D Gantt schedule tasks for object-level scheduling. This way tasks always find objects based on query rules, even when models are updated.

title: Sketch Models
description: Quickly and easily sketch 3D objects, lines, areas and volume models for various use cases.
content:
The Sketch Model tool is a powerful smart modeling tool. Sketch Model tools are used for modeling quick simple sketch models.

Element

Add individual elements with location and radius. Select a 3D model from the Library to place 3D objects in the project.

Suitable for e.g. landscaping plans, urban furniture and construction site machinery modeling.

Line

Add polyline elements with line points, width and height. When height = 0, the line follows all models and ground below the line.

Suitable for e.g. outlining roads, tracks, fences or construction site ditches.

Area

Add polyline areas with corner points and height. When height = 0, the area follows the ground surface.

Suitable for e.g. outlining building masses, parking areas or park areas.

Volume

Add volume models with corner points and height.

Suitable for e.g. modeling earthwork masses, excavations or fills.

title: Snapshot
description: Quickly see the project status through a single consolidated visual dashboard.
content:
The Snapshot tool is used to summarize the project status into a single-page status report with multiple analytical views.

Functionality

Time range selector Select the time range for which the status report is collected
Topics Pie and Table Shows a summary of topics as a pie chart and table
Velocity Analysis of how quickly topics progress or are closed
Active topics Chart of topic progress history
Project completion Shows how complete the project is based on topic statuses

Tips

Use this automatic snapshot dashboard to communicate project status to stakeholders.

title: System Settings
description: Manage general settings that affect tool behavior.
content:
System settings change the behavior of the application.

General

The following settings can be quickly toggled on/off:

Globe Global terrain model and background maps. When off, hides terrain and background maps.
Project plane Virtual project plane, if import is set to use "Plane" mode
Anti-aliasing Edge anti-aliasing
Shadows Shadows from sunlight
HUD Information display for rendering speed, such as fps
Save battery Display is not updated when no changes occur in the 3D view
Ambient occlusion Ambient occlusion effect that simulates light bouncing off surfaces
Inspection tool Special tool for inspecting model objects
Bounding volume Shows the volumes of the selected model data

Settings

The following settings can be fine-tuned:

Background color Adjust the background color visible when the globe is turned off

title: Technical Documentation
description: Technical documentation for organization IT administration.
content:
Architecture

6DPlanner is implemented on top of AWS (Amazon Web Services) cloud architecture and infrastructure. The servers and data are located in AWS data centers close to users, depending on user's region.

The service is based on a modern "serverless" cloud architecture, where processes are started as needed in parallel, which theoretically enables unlimited scalability based on usage needs.

High performance end user experience on client devices has been implemented with unique intelligent multi-resolution object level web streaming CesiumJS technology, which enables dynamic loading of data based on the viewer's location.

title: Timeline
description: Adjust time and see the project in different lighting conditions.
content:
The Timeline tool is used to change the current time of the project, and can be used for example for shadow analysis.

Functionality

Set the exact time with the date and time picker
Adjust the active time with forward / backward buttons
Move time with the mouse on the timeline slider
Play timeline animation with the Play button
Adjust the timeline's active time scale: hour / day / week / month / year

Tips

Perform sun shadow analysis with the timeline:
1. Enable shadows in system settings
2. Set the active start time precisely in the time picker
3. Set the time scale to hours
4. Move the timeline slider from left to right to simulate sunlight shadows at different times
5. You can also play the shadow analysis animation with the Play button

title: Topic List
description: Search and filter all project topics.
content:
The Topic List tool is used to manage large numbers of topics easily with sorting and filtering tools.

Functionality

Sort Click a column header to sort the content
Filter Click the filter icon in the column header to define a filter rule
Quick filter Click a cell value to filter only those values
Select Select topics using the checkbox on the left side of the table
Delete Delete selected topics with the Delete button
New Create new topics

Note: If there are many topics, they are listed on multiple pages. You can switch between pages from the page tool in the bottom right corner.

Tips

Click your name in the Person field to quickly list topics assigned to you

title: Topic Report
description: Compile all project topics into one table and export to Excel for detailed analysis.
content:
The Topic Report tool is used for reporting and summarizing all project topics into an easily readable table.

Functionality

Browse topics using the table with a scrollbar
Header columns show the topic summary
If topics have workflows, each workflow has a separate table
Export Export the topic report to Excel for further use

Tips

Use the topic report for reporting project status to end clients. The topic report shows every project topic, their status and workflow steps. This is generated automatically and saves your time.

title: Topics
description: Manage goals, requirements, tasks, risks, ideas, issues linked to location and data.
content:
The Topics tool is a powerful collaboration tool for managing various project topics such as tasks, issues, risks, requirements, comments, notes.

Topic Editor

Add and Edit

Add a new topic using the Add Topic button in the right toolbar
Open an existing topic by clicking the Topic icon in the 3D view

Edit Panel

Basic Information:
Name Topic name, displayed in the 3D view above the topic icon
Description Topic description as multi-line text
Type Notice / Comment / Idea / Task / Issue / Risk / Requirement
Priority Low / Normal / High / Critical
Status Kanban-style status for the topic
Tags Add your own tags to topics

Additional Information:
Viewpoints Topics can have multiple viewpoints
Objects List of objects related to the topic

Workflows:
Workflows are predefined processes with steps, each step having its own responsible persons and checklists.

Actions:
Viewpoint Save viewpoints to the topic
Location Set the topic's location in 3D
Link to objects Select and link objects to the topic
Save / Cancel

title: Viewpoints
description: Save viewpoints and create presentations from different situations and scenarios.
content:
The Viewpoints tool is a powerful presentation tool that replaces separate presentation tools like PowerPoint. The Viewpoints tool is used to save predefined views.

Functionality

Click a viewpoint to activate it
Click the Update icon to update the viewpoint
Click the Delete icon to delete the viewpoint
Double-click the viewpoint name to edit it

Viewpoints save and load the following settings:

Camera view
Timeline time
Data source visibility and clipping
Rendering settings such as shadows

Tips

Create interactive presentations with viewpoints, like a PowerPoint slideshow
Share presentations by sharing the project link with viewers
